channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Anthony Edwards Accuses Baby Mama of “Trapping” Him with Pregnancy Plan Using Ovulation Tracker
Ziploc hit with class-action lawsuit for allegedly misleading claims: 'Leading consumers to believe they are … without risk'
China's Nuclear Trade War Option--How Xi Could Destroy The US Housing Market In 1 Fell Swoop
Tufts University doctoral student out of ICE custody after judge orders her release
item.description: A judge has ordered that Tufts University doctoral student Rumeysa Ozturk be released on bail from ICE custody after her visa was revoked by the Trump...

item.title: The WH says Trump is considering suspending habeas corpus. What would that mean?
item.description: The move to expel migrants would curtail a constitutional right to due process.

item.title: Pope Leo XIV’s Creole heritage highlights complex history of racism and the church in America
item.description: The election of Pope Leo XIV, who is the first U.S. pope and has Creole roots, is raising more awareness about the complexity of the Creole identity.

item.title: 2nd radar outage for Newark Airport in 2 weeks leaves more flyers stranded
item.description: Newark Liberty International Airport suffered another brief air traffic control outage Friday morning, the FAA confirmed.

item.title: Trump administration must halt some DOGE cuts at 20 federal agencies
item.description: A judge is blocking the Trump administration and Elon Musk's DOGE from carrying out sweeping layoffs at over a dozen agencies — at least for now.

item.title: Hawaii secures $700 million settlement in lawsuit over blood-thinner Plavix
item.description: The settlement divides the $700 million payment equally between pharmaceutical giants Bristol Myers Squibb and Sanofi.

item.title: Trump fires longtime Librarian of Congress Carla Hayden
item.description: Carla Hayden has been the Librarian of Congress since 2016. She was the first woman and African American to hold the position.

item.title: Newark, N.J. mayor arrested at ICE facility, charged with trespassing
item.description: Newark Mayor Ras Baraka was arrested at an ICE facility during a visit with members of New Jersey's congressional delegation.

item.title: The WH says Trump is considering suspending habeas corpus. What would that mean?
Channel 5 reports meteorologist Mark Johnson 'no longer employed' at the station
High school student dies following injury in lacrosse match
item.description: An Ohio high school sophomore student has died after sustaining a lacrosse injury during a game, according to the Bay High School.

item.title: Judge pauses much of Trump administration’s massive downsizing of federal agencies
The pope is on the line: AP is there for pontiff’s call to his brother in Chicago
Democrats grapple with Biden's reemergence
item.description: Some Democrats say there is "a place for Joe Biden at the table," but others say he is best served out of the spotlight.

item.title: Here's what we know about Pope Leo XIV voting in US elections
item.description: Pope Leo XIV is registered to vote in the United States and has previously voted in some Republican primaries, but he is not registered as a member of...
